dt: {bc}a stout coarse shoe worn formerly in Ireland and the Scottish Highlands
{bc}a heavy shoe often with a hobnailed sole {bc}{sx|brogan||}
{bc}a stout oxford shoe with perforations and usually a wing tip

et: Irish {it}bróg{/it} & Scottish Gaelic {it}bròg{/it}, from Middle Irish {it}bróc{/it}, probably from Old Norse {it}brōk{/it} leg covering; akin to Old English {it}brōc{/it} leg covering {ma}{mat|breech|}{/ma}
shortdef: a stout coarse shoe worn formerly in Ireland and the Scottish Highlands
a heavy shoe often with a hobnailed sole : brogan
a stout oxford shoe with perforations and usually a wing tip

et: Irish {it}barróg{/it} accent, speech impediment, literally, wrestling hold, tight grip
shortdef: a dialect or regional pronunciation; especially : an Irish accent
